title: Calories in Rice Noodles
meta_description: Learn calories in rice noodles per 100g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition details for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Plain cooked rice noodles (boiled or steamed), no added salt, oil, or seasonings; standard Asian-style vermicelli.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (e.g., pad thai vs. vermicelli), cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked rice noodles provides ~109 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of rice noodles?
faqs.a: About 109 kcal for plain cooked rice noodles.

faqs.q: Are rice noodles low in carbs?
faqs.a: No, they have ~25g carbs per 100g, mostly from rice starch.

faqs.q: What's the protein in rice noodles?
faqs.a: Low at ~1.8g per 100g; pair with proteins for balanced meals.
Typically gluten-free, but check labels for cross-contamination.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in rice noodles?
faqs.a: Cooked absorbs water, lowering calories per gram vs. dry (364 kcal/100g).
